>
[Lethargy Poison](/Equipment.aspx?ID=120)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Alchemical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=6" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Incapacitation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=93" />
<trait label="Injury" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=97" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
<trait label="Sleep" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=145" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 552 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Price** 7 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Two Actions" /><row>Interact</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by [drow](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=37) and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

**Saving Throw** DC 18 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 4 hours; **Stage 1** [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) (1 round); **Stage 2** slowed 1 (1 minute); **Stage 3** [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) with no Perception check to wake up (1 round); **Stage 4** unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1d4 hours). 

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
